attributes.action: Demand Jeremy Hunt explains his involvement with Medical insurance groups.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dqcuaSdh6o4&feature=youtu.be

As per this video, Jeremy Hunt explains that he is 'trying to create an opportunity for private insurance companies.' We would like Jeremy Hunt to give a thorough explanation of his current and future employment prospects with these companies, and also if he has a conflict of interests with them currently?
attributes.background: To ensure that Jeremy Hunt and the government's stance on the NHS and Junior Doctor contract crisis, he should be expected to explain if he has any potential conflict of interest with medical insurance groups. Whether currently, or in the future. (Including family and friends.)

rejection.details:
At present, this would be a personal matter for the Secretary of State for Health.

Both the Ministerial Code (https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/468255/Final_draft_ministerial_code_No_AMENDS_14_Oct.pdf) and the House of Commons Code of Conduct (http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm/cmcode.htm) contain rules about the declaration of interests.

You could start a new petition calling for a specific change to either the Ministerial Code or the House of Commons Code of Conduct, asking for the rules on the declaration of interests to be changed.
